project.name: OpenVeo REST NodeJS client API
project.description: OpenVeo REST NodeJS client API to interact with OpenVeo web service

rest-client.name: rest-client
rest-client.description: Defines a client to connect to OpenVeo web service.

AuthenticationError.name: AuthenticationError
AuthenticationError.description:
Creates an authentication request error.

Authentication errors are thrown when client failed to authenticate to the web service.

params.name: message
params.description: The error message

RequestError.name: RequestError
RequestError.description:
Creates a request error with a message and http code.

Request errors are thrown when a request to the Web Service failed.

params.name: message
params.description: The error message

params.name: httpCode
params.description: The HTTP error code

OpenVeoClient.name: OpenVeoClient
OpenVeoClient.description:
Creates a client to connect to OpenVeo web service.

It aims to facilitate the interaction with OpenVeo web service. All authentication aspects are managed by the
client and are transparent to the user. Requesting an end point, without being authenticated, will automatically
authenticate first before calling the end point. If token expired, a new authentication is made automatically.

params.name: webServiceUrl
params.description: The complete url of the OpenVeo Web Service (with protocol and port)

params.name: clientId
params.description: Application's client id

params.name: clientSecret
params.description: Application's client

params.name: certificate
params.description: Path to the Web Service server trusted certificate file

throws.description: Thrown if webServiceUrl, clientId or clientSecret is not a valid String

Request.name: Request
Request.description: Creates a REST request which can be executed / aborted.

params.name: protocol
params.description: The protocol to use for the request (either 'http' or 'https')

params.name: options
params.description:
The complete list of http(s) options as described by NodeJS http.request
documentation. More headers can be added when executing the request.

params.name: body
params.description: The request body

throws.description: Thrown if protocol is not valid or options is not a valid object

classitems.description: The HTTP error code associated to this error.
classitems.name: httpCode

classitems.description: Error message.
classitems.name: message

classitems.description: Error name.
classitems.name: name

classitems.description:
Rejects all requests with the given error.

If the request is running, it will be aborted.

params.name: requests
params.description: The list of requests to reject

params.name: error
params.description: The reject's error

classitems.description: Web service protocol, either "http" or "https".
classitems.name: protocol

classitems.description: Web service server host name.
classitems.name: hostname

classitems.description: Web service server port.
classitems.name: port

classitems.description: Web service server url.
classitems.name: url

classitems.description: Application client id.
classitems.name: clientId

classitems.description: Application client secret.
classitems.name: clientSecret

classitems.description: Encoded credentials ready for OAuth authentication.
classitems.name: credentials

classitems.description: Application access token provided by the web service.
classitems.name: accessToken

classitems.description: Path to the web service server certificate file.
classitems.name: certificate

classitems.description: The collection of queued requests waiting to be executed.
classitems.name: queuedRequests

classitems.description: Maximum number of authentication attempts to perform on a request in case of an invalid or expired token.
classitems.name: maxAuthenticationAttempts

classitems.description: The authenticate request to get an access token.
classitems.name: authenticateRequest

classitems.description:
Executes a GET request.

If client is not authenticated or access token has expired, a new authentication is automatically
performed.
classitems.name: get

params.name: endPoint
params.description: The web service end point to reach with query parameters

params.name: options
params.description: The list of http(s) options as described by NodeJS http.request documentation

return.description: Promise resolving with result as an Object

throws.description: Thrown if endPoint is not valid a String

classitems.description:
Executes a POST request.

If client is not authenticated or access token has expired, a new authentication is automatically
performed.
classitems.name: post

params.name: endPoint
params.description: The web service end point to reach with query parameters

params.name: body
params.description: The request body

params.name: options
params.description: The list of http(s) options as described by NodeJS http.request documentation

return.description: Promise resolving with results as an Object

throws.description: Thrown if endPoint is not valid a String

classitems.description:
Executes a PUT request.

If client is not authenticated or access token has expired, a new authentication is automatically
performed.
classitems.name: put

params.name: endPoint
params.description: The web service end point to reach with query parameters

params.name: body
params.description: The request body

params.name: options
params.description: The list of http(s) options as described by NodeJS http.request documentation

return.description: Promise resolving with results as an Object

throws.description: Thrown if endPoint is not valid a String

classitems.description:
Executes a DELETE request.

If client is not authenticated or access token has expired, a new authentication is automatically
performed.
classitems.name: delete

params.name: endPoint
params.description: The web service end point to reach with query parameters

params.name: options
params.description: The list of http(s) options as described by NodeJS http.request documentation

return.description: Promise resolving with results as an Object

throws.description: Thrown if endPoint is not valid a String

classitems.description:
Executes a REST request after making sure the client is authenticated.

If client is not authenticated or access token has expired, a new authentication is automatically
performed and request is retried.
classitems.name: executeRequest

params.name: method
params.description: The HTTP method to use (either get, post, delete or put)

params.name: endPoint
params.description: The web service end point to reach with query parameters

params.name: options
params.description: The list of http(s) options as described by NodeJS http.request documentation

params.name: body
params.description: The request body

throws.description: Thrown if method or endPoint is not a valid String

classitems.description: Indicates if the client is authenticated to the web service or not.
classitems.name: isAuthenticated

return.description: true if the client is authenticated, false otherwise

classitems.description: Authenticates the client to the web service.
classitems.name: authenticate

return.description:
Promise resolving when the client is authenticated, promise is rejected if authentication
failed

classitems.description: Authenticates client to the web service and execute all queued requests.
Interprets response results to get a human readable error message.

params.name: result
params.description: Web service response with an eventually error property and an httpCode property

params.name: request
params.description: The request associated to the result

classitems.description: Builds a request.
classitems.name: buildRequest

params.name: options
params.description: The list of http(s) options as described by NodeJS http.request documentation

params.name: body
params.description: The request body

params.name: resolve
params.description: The function to call with request's result

params.name: reject
params.description: The function to call if request fails

return.description: The request, ready to be executed

classitems.description: Request protocol either "http" or "https".
classitems.name: protocol

classitems.description: Request options.
classitems.name: options

classitems.description: The request body.
classitems.name: body

classitems.description: The HTTP(S) request.
classitems.name: request

classitems.description: Maximum execution time for the request (in ms).
classitems.name: executionTimeout

classitems.description: Maximum time to wait until the request is aborted (in ms).
classitems.name: abortTimeout

classitems.description: Indicates if request is actually running.
classitems.name: isRunning

classitems.description: The number of attempts made on this request.
classitems.name: attempts

classitems.description:
Executes the request.

Be careful, if request is executed while still running, the running one will be aborted.
classitems.name: execute

params.name: headers
params.description:
A list of http(s) headers. Headers will be merged with Request headers set in
the constructor

return.description:
Promise resolving with request's response as an Object, all request's responses are
considered success, promise is rejected only if an error occured during the transfer or while parsing the
reponse's body (expected JSON)

throws.description: Thrown if options is not a valid object

classitems.description: Aborts the request.
classitems.name: abort

return.description:
Promise resolving when request has been aborted, promise is rejected if it takes too long
to abort the request
